gurmukhi: jwdv ky dl ky gj ky hlky dl ky hlky kir fwry ] JUm igry iek ijau DrnI mno ieMdR ky b`jR lgy igr Bwry ]1111]
transliteration: Jaadav Ke Dal Ke Gad Ke Halke Dal Ke Halke Kar(i) Ddare|| Jhoom Gire Ik Jio Dharnimano Indra Ke Bajjra Lage Gir Bhdare||1111||
translation: He, with his great strength, reduced considerable, numerous elephants and horses of the Yadava army; those warriors had fallen on the earth like the mountains, whose wings had been chopped by the Vajra (weapon) of Indra.1111.

gurmukhi: kop Bry As pwn Dry Dn isMG Ary gjrwj sMGwry ] Aaur ijqy jg puMj huqy fr mwn Bjy Aiq hI Dujvwry ]
transliteration: Kop Bhare As Paan Ddare Dhan Singhdare Gadraaj Sanhdare|| Aur Jite Jag Pounj Houte Dar Maan Bhaje At(i) Hidhujvdare||
translation: Catching hold of his sword in his hand, Dhan Singh in great rage killed many large elephants; all the remaining chariots with banners fled away in fear;

gurmukhi: qw Cib kI aupmw kib sXwm khY mn mY su ibcwr aucwry ] mwnhu ieMdR ky Awgm qy fr BU Dr kY Dr pMK pDwry ]1112]
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i) Kioupmaa Kabi Syaam Kahai Man Mai Su Bichaar Ouchdare|| Maanoh Indra Ke Aagad Te Dar Bhoo Dhar Kai Dhar Pankh Padhdare||1112||
translation: The poet says that that spectacle appeared to him like the mountains growing wings were flying away, realizing the approach of god Indra.1112.

gurmukhi: ju`D kIXo Dn isMG Gno iqhky koaU swmuih bIr n AwXo ] jo rn kop isau Awn prXo nhI jwn dIXo soeI mwr igrwXo ]
transliteration: Juddh Keeyo Dhan Singh Ghano Tihke Ko( i)  Saamuh(i) Beer Na Aayo|| Jo Ran Kop Sio Aan Daryo Nahijaan Deeyo Soimaar Giraayo||
translation: Dhan Singh waged a dreadful war and none could withstand him; whosoever came in front of him, Dhan Singh killed him in his anger;

gurmukhi: dws rQI dl isau ijm rwvn ros BrXo Aiq ju`D mcwXo ] qYsy iBrXo Dn isMG blI hin kY cqurMg cmUM puin DwXo ]1113]
transliteration: Daas Rathidal Sio Jim Raavan Ros Bdaryo At(i) Juddh Machadyo|| Taise Bhiryo Dhan Singh Balihan(i) Kai Chaturan Chamoond Poun(i) Dhaayo||1113||
translation: It appeared that Ravana had begun a terrible war with the forces of Ram; fighting in this way, destroying the four divisions of the army be rushed forward again.1113.

gurmukhi: tyr khXo Dn isMG blI rn qXwg suno hir Bwj n j`eIXY ] qw qy sMBwrkY Awin iBro inj lokn ko ibrQw n kt`eIXY ]
transliteration: Ter Kahyo Dhan Singh Baliran Tyaag Souno Har(i) Bhaaj Na Jaeeyai|| Taa Te Sanbhaar-kai Aan(i) Bhiro Nij Lokan Ko Birthaa Na Kattaeeyai||
translation: The mighty Dhan Singh shouting loudly said, “O Krishna ! do not leave the field and run away now; come yourself and fight with me; and do not get your people killed uselessly;

gurmukhi: hy bldyv srwsn lY hm so smuhwie kY ju`D kr`eIXY ] sMGr ky sm Aaur kCU nhI Xw qy duhUM jg mY jsu p`eIXY ]1114]
transliteration: He Baldev Saraasan Lai Ham So Samuhaae Kai Juddh Karaeeyai|| Sasnghar Ke Sam Aur Kachhodh Nahiyaa Te Duhoon Jag Mai Jas(u) Paeeyai||1114||
translation: “O Balram ! you may also come with your bow and arrows in your hand and fight with me, because there is nothing like the war, through which one gets praise in this and the next world.”1114.

gurmukhi: XO suin kY bqIXw Air kI qrkI mn mY Aiq kop BrXo hY ] bwn kmwn kiRpwn gdw gihkY jdubIr hUM Dwie prXo hY ]
transliteration: You Soun(i) Kai Bateeaa Ar(i) Tarkiman Mai At(i) Kop Bdaryo Hai|| Baan Kamaan Kridaan Gadaa Gadh-kai Jadoubeer Hoon|| Baan Kamaan Kridaan Gadaa Gadh-kai Jadoubeer Hoon Dhaae Daryo Hai||
translation: All this talk of the enemy went deeper into the mind of Krishna, who in great anger fell upon him catching hold of his bow, sword, mace etc.;

gurmukhi: ju`D ko Pyir iPirXo Dn isMG srwsn lY nhI nYku frXo hY ] bwnn kI brKw kir kY hir isau lir kY bil swQ ArXo hY ]1115]
transliteration: Juddh Ko Pher(i) Phiriyo Dhan Singh Saraasan Lai Nahinaik(u) Daryo Hai|| Baanan Kibarkhaa Kar(i) Kai Har(i) Sio Lar(i) Kai Bal(i) Saathdaryo Hai||1115||
translation: Dhan Singh also caught hold of his bow with fearless mind and turned again fro battle and stood firmly against Krishna.1115.

gurmukhi: ieq qy blBdR su kop BrXo auq qy Dn isMG BXo Aiq qwqo ] ju`Du kIXo irs Gwien so su duhUn ky AMgu BXo rMg rwqo ]
transliteration: It Te Balbhadra Su Kop Bdaryo Out Te Dhan Singh Bhayo At(i) Taato|| Judhh(u) Keeyo Ris Ghaain So Su Duhoon Ke An(u) Bhayo Ran Raato||
translation: On this side Balram was filled with rage and on the other side Dhan Singh got reddened with fury; both of them fought and blood oozing out of their wounds reddened their bodies;
